content:
Hello, sorry if this has already been covered somewhere but I'm not familiar with Zulip. Are there any plans to consolidate chat platforms, or is there a canonical chat platform? I see from the Rust-lang blurb that chat is spread out a bit.

I ask here because Discord is something of a gaming-centric application and I'd rather not explain to internal-IT as to why it's installed on a work computer :)
I think most people are happy with the current setup.
Discord is mostly for language users, while Zulip is mostly for compiler and tool-related discussions (and it's much better IMHO).
But you can use Discord in a browser, so I don't think it matters too much.
Ah okay, so two chat platforms but one is more ad-hoc sort of requests/conversations? (Discord?)
Zulip is nicer for less synchronous discussions
